## Advantages and Disadvantage

::: columns
::: {.column width="50%"}
::: incremental
-   Interpretability
-   Handling categorical data
-   Handling NA values
:::
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
::: incremental
-   Significant computation resources
-   Alternative methods available
    -   Filtering + Neural Network
    -   Generative and Adversarial Network
:::
:::
:::

## Scale and Resolution

::: incremental
-   Scale doesn't significantly impact the results as long as all training data are on the same scale.

-   Higher resolution requires more computing power, including both memory and processing cores.

-   The number of layers directly influences the required memory and processing cores, with more layers requiring more resources.
:::

## Computation Issue

::: columns
::: {.column .fragment width="50%"}
### Methods

::: incremental
-   Implement sampling from the original data.
-   Train the model using this sampled data.
:::
:::

::: {.column .fragment width="50%"}
### Potential drawbacks

::: incremental
-   Information loss
-   Potential bias introduced by sampling
:::
:::
:::

<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
